textos_fuente.text: Fox Hollow Golf Course | La Crosse, WI top of page HOME GOLF SIMULATOR BAR & GRILL VOLLEYBALL EVENT CENTER CAREERS SHOP More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. WELCOME TO FOX HOLLOW A scenic 18 hole course with a full service sports bar & restaurant Fox Hollow Golf Course and Event Center is tucked between beautiful rolling hillsides of La Crosse County. Our facility features a magnificent golf course, clubhouse, outdoor shelter, two volleyball courts and a 10,000 square foot events center. Fox Hollow has been a family owned and operated business since opening in 1994, and we pride ourselves on providing a great golfing experience for our patrons. ​ This scenic 18-hole course is a par 70 and has been tailored to be challenging and enjoyable for all skill levels. Before or after your game of golf, or anytime you want a great meal, visit the bar & grill where we have elevated the casual pub food to go along with the best craft beer selection in the area. ​ Come by and experience all that Fox Hollow has to offer. We're located on County Highway O in La Crosse County, just 10 minutes from La Crosse and 5 minutes from Valley View Mall and Hwy. 33. GOLF Our course consists of 120 acres of gently rolling hills and features one of only two island greens in Wisconsin. A creek runs along nine holes of the course. ​ Membership is open to the public. We are also home to the West Salem High School Golf Team. ​ Our pro shop is fully equipped with golf balls, tees, clothing, and club rentals. LEARN MORE bar&grill Our bar & grill is open year round. Experience our elevated food and beverage menu and meet our friendly staff who will work hard to serve your needs. LEARN MORE VOLLEYBALL We have two sand volleyball courts. Leagues are offered Tuesday through Thursday night. Courts are open to the public when leagues aren't in play. Volleyballs are not provided for non-league play. LEARN MORE Event center Our 10,000 square foot event center is perfect for all occasions and capable of accommodating over 300 people. We maintain a full kitchen on the premises, and supply the complete wait staff for your convenience. ​ Our facility is ideal for all occasions, including: ​ Wedding Receptions Christmas Parties Rehearsal Dinners Anniversary Parties Retirement Parties Business Meetings Conventions LEARN MORE W4131 Cty Rd O | La Crosse, WI 54601 608-786-4653 | info@foxhollowgb.com © 2025 Fox Hollow bottom of page

About Us - Fox Hollow Golf Club (TPA) Skip to main content Skip to primary sidebar Skip to footer Fox Hollow Golf Club (TPA) dcreighton@foxhollowgolfclub.com 727-376-6333 Book A Tee Time Home About Us About Us Directions Photo Gallery Golf Scorecard and Golf Holes Tee Times & Rates Hole Layout Rental Clubs Instruction Golf Clinics & Leagues Upcoming Events Events Weddings + Special Events Banquet Menus Event Inquiries Preferred Vendors Grille Restaurant Grille Restaurant Information Menus Special Events Membership Membership Information Membership Rates Contact Contact Us Online News Sign Up About Us Fox Hollow Golf Club is one of the premier golf courses in the state and was recently rated 57th by Golf Digest’s Top 75 Courses Accessible to the Public in Florida. Purchased by the Creighton family in 2013, one of their goals was to take the course to a higher level by upgrading course conditions and constantly making improvements. Dave Creighton Sr. owned and operated several courses in Florida starting with Northdale Golf Club from 1980 to 2000. Other courses include Rosemont, Kissimmee, Celebration, Countryway, Lexington Oaks and now Fox Hollow. Dave Sr. had a 21-year professional hockey career including 11 seasons in the NHL with the Boston Bruins, Toronto Maple Leafs, Chicago Black Hawks and New York Rangers. Son Adam followed his dad’s path into professional hockey with a 14-year NHL career, including two years with the Tampa Bay Lightning (1992/93 and (1993/94). Since the Creighton’s purchased Fox Hollow in 2013, they have continued to upgrade the course each year.  Because of this, the course and amenities have been taken to a higher level. Opening in 1994, the Fox Hollow golf course has the distinction of being one of the last courses designed and built by Robert Trent Jones, Sr., one of the most prolific and innovative golf course designers of all time. In his design of Fox Hollow, the legendary Jones created a layout as picturesque as it is playable. Quite simply, Fox Hollow offers a good, fair test of golf. The par-71 championship layout features five sets of tees and offers new challenges every time it’s played, mixing native trees and vegetation, sparkling lakes, sand bunkers and a variety of wildlife. Fox Hollow’s rolling fairways are a delightful departure from the pancake-flat layouts found elsewhere in Florida. The putting surfaces at Fox Hollow feature SeaDwarf Paspalum, a hearty turfgrass that can be irrigated with effluent, reclaimed, or even seawater. This grass also has the ability to deliver fast green speeds (9+ on the Stimpmeter) and requires less fertilizer, pesticide, weed control and irrigation. Arguably, Fox Hollow possesses some of the finest quality, most environmentally friendly green complexes in the Tampa Bay area. Convenience and an emphasis on friendly, unobtrusive service also contribute to the Fox Hollow experience. From the time you drop off your clubs until you reach the first tee, everything you need is readily accessible. The 15,000 square foot clubhouse is the focal point, featuring a fully stocked pro shop, locker rooms, private meeting rooms and an upscale dining room to serve as an alternative to the more relaxed atmosphere of the “Grille at Fox Hollow Golf Club.” Both share spectacular views of the 10th and 18th holes of the golf course. If awards are what you’re looking for, the Tampa Tribune has placed Fox Hollow on its list of top three public-access courses in all of west central Florida; and Central Florida Magazine says the 18th hole, with its forced carry off the tee and water running the entire length of the hole on both sides of the fairway, is simply the “Best Par 4 in Florida”. Water comes into play on 11 holes and Jones’ other signature feature – plentiful, profound and penal bunker complexes – abounds. Fox Hollow has hosted local qualifying for the U.S. Open as well as qualifiers for the Valspar Championship, the PGA Tour event held annually at Innisbrook Golf Resort. Events The Fox Hollow clubhouse is available for tournaments, private parties, weddings, receptions and dinners, all catered by its professional events staff. The staff will help design the menu, handle the details and have the golf course in impeccable condition for your event. They handle tournament groups from 20 to 144 players. Competitive pricing is available. For more information, visit FoxHollowGolfClub.com or call (727) 376-6333. Practice Facilities As you exit the clubhouse, Fox Hollow’s practice facilities are all within easy walking distance. The practice facility consists of a grass driving range with over 25 hitting stations, a chipping green with a practice bunker, and a 10,800 square foot practice putting green. Lessons and clinics are available, taught by Fox Hollow’s highly experienced PGA & LPGA professional teaching staff. Memberships Three attractive golf membership packages are available: Junior, Intermediate and Regular. Both single and family memberships are available in all three categories. Regular and family members may book tee times up to fourteen days in advance. Daily Fee Players Welcome Fox Hollow is a semi-private club. Another initiative taken by the Creighton family is a significant reduction in the rate structure. Playing Fox Hollow has never been more affordable. Reserve tee times online at FoxHollowGolfClub.com or call the pro shop at (727) 376-6333. Instruction - Fox Hollow Golf Club (TPA) Skip to main content Skip to primary sidebar Skip to footer Fox Hollow Golf Club (TPA) dcreighton@foxhollowgolfclub.com 727-376-6333 Book A Tee Time Home About Us About Us Directions Photo Gallery Golf Scorecard and Golf Holes Tee Times & Rates Hole Layout Rental Clubs Instruction Golf Clinics & Leagues Upcoming Events Events Weddings + Special Events Banquet Menus Event Inquiries Preferred Vendors Grille Restaurant Grille Restaurant Information Menus Special Events Membership Membership Information Membership Rates Contact Contact Us Online News Sign Up Instruction Ages and Skill Levels Have You Ever Experienced the Sensation That Hitting It Pure Can Bring? Let our professionals teach you how to consistently hit it pure, greatly enhance your enjoyment of the game and allow you to experience one of the true joys in life-the pure golf shot! The Fox Hollow teaching staff offers a wide variety of lesson plans to fit your comfort level and to help you get your game where you want it to be. Whether you’re a beginner, a novice, or an established player, we all need help from the professionals to bring us to the next level. Be it a private lesson, group lesson, clinic, or even a 9 or 18-hole playing lesson, the staff at Fox Hollow is available to help you with your game every day of the week! Private Lessons One-on-one instruction allows you the opportunity to maximize your time and build a solid, student-teacher relationship with your instructor. Utilizing video instruction will accelerate the learning process and enhance your feedback. PGA accredited instructors are available for 30 or 60-minute sessions. No matter where you are in your game, no matter what your handicap, our instructors can and will help you get better! Group Clinics All Sorts of Clinics for All Types of Shots What Do You Want To Work On Today? Fox Hollow will be conducting group clinics for a variety of groups and skill levels. We will have clinics for men, women, juniors, and beginners. We’ll also conduct specialty clinics focusing on the swing, iron and wood play, driving, fairway shots, short game, bunker play, and putting. Call the pro shop for more information: 727-376-6333 ext 1. Click here for upcoming Golf Clinics and Leagues. Click here for Junior Golf information. Playing Lessons How well do you manage your game? Playing lessons offer the student a unique and revealing glimpse into his or her own golf game. How many times does a bad decision cost you a stroke or even two? Playing lessons can teach you about the thought process that goes into really improving your score. Get feedback and guidance from tee to green to find out how the pros really do think their way around the course. Meet Our Instructors Our Golf Instructors at Fox Hollow Golf Club offers instructional excellence whether you are a beginner new to the game or an advanced player! We offer a wide range of instruction from private lessons, groups, and clinics. Ongoing clinics offered with LPGA Professional Suzie Fisher. For information on golf instruction rates and schedules contact the individual instructor for more information on the type of instructions that meets your needs. Suzie Fisher LPGA Suzie Fisher, LPGA Director of Instruction 918-269-3638 sfisher2450@gmail.com Teaching Professional – Private Lessons, Group, and Clinics. Ongoing clinics offered – Ladies, Men’s and Jr’s Beginners, Intermediate to Advanced. All Ages and Skill Levels. https://suziefishergolf.com Frank Reynolds PGA Teaching Professional 813-376-4793. freynol2@tampabay.rr.com PGA Life Member and Former PGA Teacher of the Year. Teaching Professional – Private Lessons for Intermediate to Advanced. Ages: Adult Scott Cummings Fox Hollow Golf Club Assistant 727-376-6333 Scummings@foxhollowgolfclub.com Instruction – Private Lessons Beginners, Intermediate to Advanced. All Ages and Skill Levels. Special Occasions Overview Our spaces Private dining Meeting packages Team Building Catering Special Occasions Christmas Filming & Production Nestled in Chertsey, Surrey, Foxhills is a stone's throw from Woking and Guildford and just 20 minutes from Heathrow Airport. Thanks to our close proximity to the M3 and M25, we couldn't be easier to get to. Find us . CEO, Marc Hayton, and his family have owned the club for 40 years. Always striving to provide members and guests with a unique country club experience so that when you leave, you feel better than when you arrived. 1780s The mercurial 18th century politician Charles James Fox came to live in the area in the 1780s with his mistress and former courtesan Elizabeth Armistead. A brilliant young parliamentarian (MP for Midhurst aged just 19), Fox was a passionate orator with an appetite for gambling and the high life; he once made a wager with the Prince Regent as to the number of cats they would see on Bond Street, and survived a shot in his ample belly during a duel in Hyde Park, quipping he would have died had his opponent, William Adam, not used the government issued gunpowder. A member of the Prince of Wales’ set, Fox never endeared himself to the establishment of George the Third. Neither did his intellectual support for revolutionary causes in France and America, nor his espousal of civil liberties and slave emancipation. When ill health struck, and gambling debts forced him out of London, Fox sought to restore his body and spirit in the peace of his country estate and company of his neighbour and friend Sir Joseph Mawbey at Botley Park. He returned to public life in 1801, before his death in 1806. 1817 Sir Joseph did not long outlive Fox and estate broke up upon his death in 1817. His son-in-law, John Ivatt-Briscoe, bought the area then known as Fox’s Hill and France Farm. A successful lawyer and local MP, Ivatt-Briscoe commissioned the architect Basevi, cousin to Disraeli whose work included Ely Cathedral (Cambridge), to build the current Manor House. A prodigy of the great Classicist Sir John Soane, Basevi designed the Manor to reflect the spirit of the new Victorian age in its restrained charm and elegance. As an MP, Ivatt-Briscoe was concerned with local issues, helping to found the Chertsey Agricultural Association, whose annual ploughing match is held to this day. His only national initiative was to campaign for the outlaw of the treadmill as a form of punishment! 1870s In the 1870s, the estate was passed to a distant relative of Ivatt-Briscoe, General Hutton. A veteran of the Zulu and Boer wars, Hutton took an active role in parish life and invited the families of men who fell under his command to play in the grounds during their holidays. 1920-1990 After serving as a convalescent home for wounded officers during the Great War, the estate was sold to the Borthwicks, a successful merchant family in the 1920s. They ran the estate and farm in a manner unchanged since Ivatt-Briscoe, with a staff totalling 15 including a second chauffeur, Trevor Francis and third housemaid, Evelyn. Fraternisation amongst staff was not encouraged and when their relationship was discovered, she was forced to leave the estate. The couple subsequently married in 1940, and in 1990 returned to the Manor House to celebrate their 50th wedding anniversary. 1960-1975 During the Second World War, the family energetically turned the farm – now the site of the Bernard Hunt golf course – over to the Dig for Victory campaign. By the 1960s, a gradual decline had set in and saw the estate sold before being turned into a golf club in 1975, owned by Aer Lingus and known as Foxhills. 1983-Present Pam and Ian Hayton purchased the club in 1983, with their son Marc taking over as Managing Director in 2005. Marc is now CEO of the Foxhills Collection with Tej Walia taking over as Managing Director in 2023. In addition to strengthening the club’s reputation as a family-friendly leisure destination, Foxhills has expanded its sporting facilities far beyond a simple golf course to cater for the diverse interests of its members and visitors. With a growing membership and a strong reputation as a business and leisure destination, the love of food, wine and gracious living which Charles James Fox displayed in the 18 th century lives on. Conveniently situated in the west metro of the Twin Cities, Fox Hollow has a proud tradition of hosting state tournaments, including the 2008 U.S. Amateur Public Links Championship. Experience our redesigned Back 9, featuring breathtaking Holes 16 and 17. Enjoy the dramatic downhill drop on the par-3 15th hole and the challenging uphill 18th, leading to a memorable three-tiered green. Discover why Fox Hollow is known for having four of the best finishing holes in the metro area. Our clubhouse offers elegant and casual event spaces for weddings, receptions, meetings, and banquets, accommodating up to 240 guests. Our dedicated staff ensures every event receives exceptional service. Practice your swing at our top-rated facility, which includes a full-length driving range, two putting and chipping greens, and a practice bunker. Book your tee time today at one of the best golf courses in St. Michael, MN! The Perfect Upscale Public Golf Experience Golf Outings Fox Hollow is the best choice in the West metro to host your group golf outing welcoming you with a Championship golf course, expansive practice facility, outdoor patio & welcoming clubhouse… learn more Weddings & Special Events Nestled along the Crow River, Fox Hollow provides a beautiful backdrop for your event including the option for outdoor wedding ceremonies and banquet hall reception for up to 240 guests… learn more Golf Leagues Fox Hollow Golf Club offers both Men’s & Ladies leagues plus exciting course events. We invite you to join one of the most active public course clubs including Saturday & Wednesday options… learn more Follow Us! Win Free Golf & Get Course News Be entered into our drawings for free golf, keep updated on course news, get email-only special offers & advance invites to fun course events. Sign Up > Tampa Bay’s Premier Semi Private Golf Facility As one of Robert Trent Jones Sr.’s last designs, Fox Hollow Golf Club opened it’s doors in 1994.  The course has grown and developed into one of the premier semi-private golf facilities in the Tampa Bay area.  The par 71 layout features Sea Dwarf, Seashore Paspalum greens, rolling fairways, and large white sand bunkers.  The four sets of tees provide a true test for golfers of all skill levels. Learn More More Than A Great Golf Course The professional teaching staff is knowledgeable in all aspects of the game and they can provide instruction tailored to your individual needs. The practice facility consists of a grass driving range with over 25 hitting stations, a chipping green with a practice bunker, and a 10,800 square foot practice putting green. The Grille’s dining room not only provides the perfect weekly dining destination, but also serves as an ideal location for private parties- including weddings. We have built an upscale dining room to serve as an alternative to the more relaxed atmosphere at The Grille. Both the Tavern and the Banquet Room will share the fantastic views of the 18 green, 10 tee and the beautiful 10- acre lake. Play Our Golf Course Today! Fox Hollow Golf Club - About Us Expand/collapse navigation Home About Us Contact Directions Photo Gallery Video Golf Tee Times Rates Hole Layouts Instruction Golf Clinics and Leagues Junior Golf The Golf Shop Upcoming Events Weddings & Events Banquet Menus Wedding Packages Event Inquiries Preferred Vendors The Grille Menus Kids Menu Breakfast Specials / Events Membership Membership Rates Directions Trinity, FL Trinity, FL Home About Us Contact Directions Photo Gallery Golf Weddings & Events The Grille Membership Directions Fox Hollow Golf Club: Tampa Bay's Premier Semi Private Golf Facility Fox Hollow Golf Club is one of the premier golf courses in the state and was recently rated 57th by Golf Digest’s Top 75 Courses Accessible to the Public in Florida. Purchased by the Creighton
family in 2013, one of their goals was to take the course to a higher level by upgrading course conditions and constantly making improvements. Dave Creighton Sr. owned and operated several courses in Florida starting with Northdale Golf Club from 1980 to 2000. Other courses include Rosemont, Kissimmee, Celebration, Countryway, Lexington
Oaks and now Fox Hollow. Dave Sr. had a 21-year professional hockey career including 11 seasons in the NHL with the Boston Bruins, Toronto Maple Leafs, Chicago Black Hawks and New York Rangers. Son Adam followed his dad’s
path into professional hockey with a 14-year NHL career, including two years with the Tampa Bay Lightning (1992/93 and (1993/94). Dave’s other son Dave Jr. is an accomplished PGA golf professional. He has spent his career managing the family’s golf course properties. When the Creighton’s purchased Fox Hollow in August of 2013 they immediately started upgrading the facility. New machinery was purchased for golf course maintenance and different maintenance
practices were followed to ensure that the golf course is always in great condition. The restaurant and banquet room also went through a facelift and were upgraded with new furniture and décor in
2014. Opening in 1994, the Fox Hollow golf course has the distinction of being one of the last courses designed and built by Robert Trent Jones, Sr., one of the most prolific and innovative golf course
designers of all time. In his design of Fox Hollow, the legendary Jones created a layout as picturesque as it is playable. Quite simply, Fox Hollow offers a good, fair test of golf. The par-71 championship layout features five sets of tees and offers new challenges every time it’s played, mixing native trees and vegetation, sparkling lakes, sand bunkers and a variety of
wildlife. Fox Hollow’s rolling fairways are a delightful departure from the pancake-flat layouts found elsewhere in Florida. The putting surfaces at Fox Hollow feature SeaDwarf Paspalum, a hearty turfgrass that can be irrigated with effluent, reclaimed, or even seawater. This grass also has the ability to deliver fast
green speeds (9+ on the Stimpmeter) and requires less fertilizer, pesticide, weed control and irrigation. Arguably, Fox Hollow possesses some of the finest quality, most environmentally friendly
green complexes in the Tampa Bay area. Convenience and an emphasis on friendly, unobtrusive service also contribute to the Fox Hollow experience. From the time you drop off your clubs until you reach the first tee, everything you need
is readily accessible. The 15,000 square foot clubhouse is the focal point, featuring a fully stocked pro shop, locker rooms, private meeting rooms and an upscale dining room to serve as an
alternative to the more relaxed atmosphere of the “Grille at Fox Hollow Golf Club.” Both share spectacular views of the 10 th and 18 th holes of the golf course. If awards are what you’re looking for, the Tampa Tribune has placed Fox Hollow on its list of top three public-access courses in all of west central Florida; and Central Florida Magazine says the
18th hole, with its forced carry off the tee and water running the entire length of the hole on both sides of the fairway, is simply the “Best Par 4 in Florida”. Water comes into play on 11 holes and
Jones’ other signature feature – plentiful, profound and penal bunker complexes – abounds. Fox Hollow has hosted local qualifying for the U.S. Open as well as qualifiers for the Valspar Championship, the PGA Tour event held annually at Innisbrook Golf Resort. Events The Fox Hollow clubhouse is available for tournaments, private parties, weddings, receptions and dinners, all catered by its professional events staff. The staff will help design the menu, handle
the details and have the golf course in impeccable condition for your event. They handle tournament groups from 20 to 144 players. Competitive pricing is available. For more information, visit FoxHollowGolfClub.com or call (727) 376-6333 Practice Facilities As you exit the clubhouse, Fox Hollow’s practice facilities are all within easy walking distance. The practice facility consists of a grass driving range with over 25 hitting stations, a chipping
green with a practice bunker, and a 10,800 square foot practice putting green. Lessons and clinics are available, taught by Fox Hollow’s highly experienced PGA professional teaching staff. Memberships Three attractive golf membership packages are available: Junior, Intermediate and Regular. Both single and family memberships are available in all three categories. Regular and family members may
book tee times up to fourteen days in advance. Daily Fee Players Welcome Fox Hollow is a semi-private club. Daily fee players are always welcome. Another initiative taken by the Creighton family is a significant reduction in the rate structure. Playing Fox Hollow has
never been more affordable. Reserve tee times online at FoxHollowGolfClub.com or call the pro shop at (727) 376-6333. Junior Golf Programs - Fox Hollow Golf Club (TPA) Skip to main content Skip to primary sidebar Skip to footer Fox Hollow Golf Club (TPA) dcreighton@foxhollowgolfclub.com 727-376-6333 Book A Tee Time Home About Us About Us Directions Photo Gallery Golf Scorecard and Golf Holes Tee Times & Rates Hole Layout Rental Clubs Instruction Golf Clinics & Leagues Upcoming Events Events Weddings + Special Events Banquet Menus Event Inquiries Preferred Vendors Grille Restaurant Grille Restaurant Information Menus Special Events Membership Membership Information Membership Rates Contact Contact Us Online News Sign Up Junior Golf Programs U.S. Kids Golf Academy at Fox Hollow Golf Club with Master Top 50 Kids Coach Suzie Fisher The concept and intent of the Fox Hollow Junior Programs represent a serious commitment toward the development of young golfers. Our goal is to provide an enjoyable and fulfilling experience ~ the kind that will help them develop maturity, good habits, and sound values. The improvement of our juniors’ golfing skills is just one objective of our program. Observing one’s own progress provides pleasure and satisfaction and is very important to any youngster. Working on fine motor skills also has its share of educational opportunities, such as exposure to the undeniable law of effort and reward – and its relationship to success and failure. However, skill improvement is not the only objective of our program. Fairness and equitable treatment, as taught through the rules of golf, are equally applicable to the rules of life in general. Courage, perseverance, and self-control are enduring values that can strengthen a youngster’s character through competitive golf. We look forward to helping each youngster develop skills in golf – a sport that is so aptly described as “the game for a lifetime.” Total Development Social Physical Emotional Educational Certainly one of the most important aspects of starting juniors in golf and in maintaining their interests is in providing proper golf equipment. Our goal is to make clubs available and affordable to our junior golfers. Our “clubs for kids” program is designed to get the juniors started and to ascertain their level of interest. Once the junior is “committed” to the game we recommend that you order top of the line manufactured models. Our golf professionals will offer club fitting advice to every junior in our program.
